content: This is meta description
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: Install this template by following those simple steps:
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-1 : Hugo installation Check this link below for install hugo on your computer. hugo install documentation
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-2 : Create your project Hugo provides a new command to create a new website. hugo new site <new_project>
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-3 : Install the theme Run this command hugo new site meghna-hugo and then go to the themes folder inside of meghna-hugo folder. You can also use this command cd meghna-hugo/themes for going to this folder. Then run the command git clone git@github.com:themefisher/meghna-hugo.git Alternatively, you can download the theme as .zip file and extract it in the themes directory After that you need to go to the meghna-hugo/exampleSite folder and copy or cut all the elements, and now go back to the root folder and paste it here. open the command prompt again and run cd ../ command for go back to the root folder.
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-4 : Host locally Launching the website locally by using the following command: hugo serve Go to http://localhost:1313 Or you can check this video documentation for installing this template:
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-5 : Basic configuration When building the website, you can set a theme by using --theme option. However, we suggest you modify the configuration file (config.toml) and set the theme as the default. # Change the default theme to be use when building the site with Hugo theme = "meghna-hugo"
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-6 : Create your first content pages hugo new blog/post-name.md
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-7 : Build the website When your site is ready to deploy, run the following command: hugo # You can also create a minified version by using this command: hugo--minify A public folder will be generated, containing all static content and assets for your website. It can now be deployed on any web server.
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-1 : Hugo installation Check this link below for install hugo on your computer. hugo install documentation

content: STEP-2 : Create your project Hugo provides a new command to create a new website. hugo new site <new_project>
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-3 : Install the theme Run this command hugo new site meghna-hugo and then go to the themes folder inside of meghna-hugo folder. You can also use this command cd meghna-hugo/themes for going to this folder. Then run the command git clone git@github.com:themefisher/meghna-hugo.git Alternatively, you can download the theme as .zip file and extract it in the themes directory After that you need to go to the meghna-hugo/exampleSite folder and copy or cut all the elements, and now go back to the root folder and paste it here. open the command prompt again and run cd ../ command for go back to the root folder.
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-4 : Host locally Launching the website locally by using the following command: hugo serve Go to http://localhost:1313 Or you can check this video documentation for installing this template:
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-5 : Basic configuration When building the website, you can set a theme by using --theme option. However, we suggest you modify the configuration file (config.toml) and set the theme as the default. # Change the default theme to be use when building the site with Hugo theme = "meghna-hugo"
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-6 : Create your first content pages hugo new blog/post-name.md
title: How To Setup Meghna Hugo

content: STEP-7 : Build the website When your site is ready to deploy, run the following command: hugo # You can also create a minified version by using this command: hugo--minify A public folder will be generated, containing all static content and assets for your website. It can now be deployed on any web server.
